resources.name: Anki
resources.description: Powerful, intelligent flashcard app using spaced repetition for efficient memorization.
resources.descriptionLong: Anki is a free, open-source flashcard application that uses spaced repetition algorithms to optimize your learning. It's particularly popular among Japanese learners for memorizing kanji, vocabulary, and grammar patterns. The app supports multimedia cards, custom deck creation, and has a vast library of shared decks. Anki's algorithm adapts to your performance, showing difficult cards more frequently while spacing out cards you know well.
resources.priceDetails: Free on desktop and Android. AnkiMobile (iOS) is $24.99
resources.notes: The iOS app price supports development. AnkiWeb allows free syncing across devices.

resources.name: WaniKani
resources.description: Kanji and vocabulary learning app using mnemonics and spaced repetition.
resources.descriptionLong: WaniKani is a web-based application focused on teaching kanji and vocabulary through a structured curriculum using mnemonics and spaced repetition. Created by Tofugu, it teaches over 2,000 kanji and 6,000 vocabulary words through a radical-based approach. Each kanji comes with memorable stories and the system ensures you learn readings in context through vocabulary.
resources.notes: First 3 levels are free. Community-created apps available for mobile.

resources.name: Bunpro
resources.description: Grammar learning platform with SRS and comprehensive JLPT coverage.
resources.descriptionLong: Bunpro is a grammar-focused learning platform that uses spaced repetition to help you master Japanese grammar points. It covers all JLPT levels from N5 to N1 with detailed explanations, example sentences, and links to external resources. The platform tracks your progress and adapts reviews based on your performance.
resources.notes: Includes vocabulary and reading features. Free trial available.

resources.name: jpdb
resources.description: Vocabulary learning with frequency lists from anime, novels, and visual novels.
resources.descriptionLong: jpdb is a unique vocabulary learning platform that provides frequency lists based on specific media like anime, light novels, visual novels, and more. You can study vocabulary from your favorite shows or books before watching/reading them. The SRS system helps you retain words efficiently.
resources.notes: Great for preparing to consume specific Japanese media.

resources.name: Takoboto
resources.description: Comprehensive Japanese dictionary with offline support and flashcards.
resources.descriptionLong: Takoboto is a feature-rich Japanese dictionary app for Android that works offline. It includes example sentences, kanji information, verb conjugations, and built-in flashcard functionality. The app supports multiple search methods including romaji, kana, kanji, and English.
resources.notes: Android only. One of the best free dictionary apps available.

resources.name: Jisho
resources.description: Popular online Japanese-English dictionary with powerful search features.
resources.descriptionLong: Jisho is a powerful Japanese-English dictionary that lets you search using Japanese, romaji, or English. It provides detailed information including kanji stroke order, example sentences, JLPT level, and word frequency. The clean interface and comprehensive data make it a go-to resource for learners.
resources.notes: Supports drawing kanji to search. Uses JMdict and KANJIDIC data.

resources.name: Shirabe Jisho
resources.description: Beautiful iOS Japanese dictionary with handwriting recognition.
resources.descriptionLong: Shirabe Jisho is an elegant Japanese dictionary app for iOS devices. It features handwriting recognition for kanji lookup, detailed word entries with example sentences, and a clean, native iOS design. The app works offline and includes flashcard functionality.
resources.notes: iOS exclusive. Beautiful design with powerful features.

resources.name: Duolingo Japanese
resources.description: Gamified language learning app with Japanese course.
resources.descriptionLong: Duolingo offers a free Japanese course with gamified lessons covering hiragana, katakana, vocabulary, and basic grammar. The app uses bite-sized lessons, streaks, and achievements to keep learners motivated. While not as comprehensive as dedicated Japanese apps, it's a good starting point for absolute beginners.
resources.priceDetails: Free with ads. Super Duolingo removes ads and adds features.
resources.notes: Best for absolute beginners. Limited for intermediate+ learners.

resources.name: LingoDeer
resources.description: Structured Japanese course app designed for Asian languages.
resources.descriptionLong: LingoDeer is a language learning app specifically designed for Asian languages including Japanese. It offers structured lessons covering grammar, vocabulary, and all writing systems. The app provides detailed grammar explanations and uses native speaker audio throughout.
resources.notes: Better grammar explanations than Duolingo. Good for beginners.

resources.name: Human Japanese
resources.nameJa: ヒューマン・ジャパニーズ
resources.description: In-depth Japanese course app with detailed explanations.
resources.descriptionLong: Human Japanese is a comprehensive Japanese learning app that reads like an interactive textbook. It provides thorough explanations of grammar, writing systems, and cultural context. The app includes audio from native speakers and interactive exercises to reinforce learning.
resources.notes: Two apps: Human Japanese (beginner) and Human Japanese Intermediate.

resources.name: Japanese.io
resources.description: Reading practice app with built-in dictionary and SRS.
resources.descriptionLong: Japanese.io helps you read Japanese content with instant word lookups and automatic flashcard creation. Paste any Japanese text and the app will help you understand it while building your vocabulary. Great for reading practice with native content.
resources.priceDetails: Free tier available. Premium for additional features.
resources.notes: Excellent for reading practice with any Japanese text.

resources.name: Renshuu
resources.description: Comprehensive Japanese study app with games and community features.
resources.descriptionLong: Renshuu is an all-in-one Japanese learning platform offering vocabulary, kanji, grammar, and sentence practice. It includes gamification elements, a supportive community, and customizable study schedules. The app covers all JLPT levels and offers various practice modes.
resources.notes: Very feature-rich with an active community.

resources.name: Kanji Study
resources.description: Comprehensive kanji learning app with writing practice.
resources.descriptionLong: Kanji Study is a dedicated kanji learning app for Android that covers all joyo kanji plus more. It includes detailed kanji information, writing practice with stroke order, flashcards, and quizzes. The app organizes kanji by JLPT level, grade, and frequency.
resources.priceDetails: Free with in-app purchases for full content
resources.notes: Android only. One of the best kanji apps available.

resources.name: Gboard Japanese
resources.description: Google's keyboard with excellent Japanese input support.
resources.descriptionLong: Gboard is Google's keyboard app that includes excellent Japanese input capabilities. It supports romaji-to-kana conversion, flick input, handwriting recognition, and predictive text. The keyboard learns from your typing patterns and suggests relevant words.
resources.notes: Essential for typing Japanese on mobile devices.

resources.name: Microsoft Japanese IME
resources.description: Built-in Japanese input method for Windows.
resources.descriptionLong: Microsoft Japanese IME is the built-in Japanese input method editor for Windows. It allows you to type Japanese using romaji input and provides kanji conversion suggestions. The IME is well-integrated with Windows and supports various input modes.
resources.notes: Built into Windows. Enable in language settings.

resources.name: Satori Reader
resources.description: Graded reading app with native audio and detailed explanations.
resources.descriptionLong: Satori Reader provides graded Japanese reading content with professional native audio, detailed grammar notes, and vocabulary support. Stories are written specifically for learners and gradually increase in difficulty. Each sentence can be broken down with explanations.
resources.notes: Excellent for bridging the gap to native content.

resources.name: Todai Easy Japanese
resources.description: Japanese news app with reading assistance features.
resources.descriptionLong: Todai Easy Japanese provides Japanese news articles with built-in reading assistance. Articles include furigana, word definitions, and text-to-speech. The app offers content at various difficulty levels and is great for daily reading practice.
resources.priceDetails: Free with premium subscription for additional features
resources.notes: Great for daily reading practice with current events.

resources.name: Migaku
resources.description: Browser extension suite for immersion learning.
resources.descriptionLong: Migaku is a suite of browser extensions designed for immersion-based Japanese learning. It includes tools for looking up words, creating flashcards from content you consume, and tracking your learning. Works with Netflix, YouTube, and web pages.
resources.notes: Essential tool for immersion learners.

resources.name: Yomitan
resources.description: Powerful browser popup dictionary for Japanese.
resources.descriptionLong: Yomitan (formerly Yomichan) is a browser extension that provides instant Japanese word lookups by hovering over text. It supports multiple dictionaries, Anki integration for flashcard creation, and audio pronunciation. An essential tool for reading Japanese online.
resources.notes: Must-have for reading Japanese on the web. Highly customizable.

resources.name: Akebi
resources.description: Feature-rich Japanese dictionary for Android.
resources.descriptionLong: Akebi is a comprehensive Japanese dictionary app for Android with a beautiful interface. It includes multiple dictionaries, example sentences, kanji information, and flashcard functionality. The app supports various search methods and works offline.
resources.notes: Android only. Clean interface with powerful features.

resources.name: Japanese Dungeon
resources.description: RPG-style game for learning Japanese vocabulary.
resources.descriptionLong: Japanese Dungeon combines RPG gameplay with Japanese vocabulary learning. Battle monsters by answering Japanese questions correctly, level up your character, and progress through dungeons. A fun way to review vocabulary and kanji.
resources.notes: Fun gamified approach to vocabulary review.
